verses.roman:
'kṛṣṇa-rāsa-pañcādhyāya' karite paṭhana
ekale yāi' mahāprabhura dharibe caraṇa

synonyms: kṛṣṇa-rāsa-pañca-adhyāya—the five chapters in the Tenth Canto of Śrīmad-Bhāgavatam in which Lord Kṛṣṇa's pastimes of the rāsa dance are described; karite paṭhana—to recite; ekale yāi'—going alone; mahāprabhura—of Lord Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; dharibe caraṇa—catch hold of the lotus feet.
translation: "When Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu enters the Guṇḍicā, you should also go there and read the five chapters about Lord Kṛṣṇa's dancing with the gopīs. In this way you can catch hold of the Lord's lotus feet.
